greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 3*a(n-2) for n > 2; a(1) = 3, a(2) = -1.
comment: Equivalently, 3^n followed by -3^(n-1), n > 0. - _Muniru A Asiru_, Oct 25 2018
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,3).
mathematica: Rest[CoefficientList[Series[x*(3-x)/(1-3*x^2), {x, 0, 40}], x]] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{0,3}, {3,-1}, 40] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 24 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) [ n le 2 select 7-4*n else 3*Self(n-2): n in [1..34] ];
(GAP) a:=[3,-1];; for n in [3..25] do a[n]:=3*a[n-2]; od; a; # _Muniru A Asiru_, Oct 25 2018
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jul 14 2009
